Key Match Events: South Korea won 5-0 against Singapore on Thursday
China won 2-1 against Thailand on Thursday
Lee Kang-in scored one and assisted one against Singapore
Wu Lei scored his 33rd goal for China against Thailand
Pre-Game Insights: South Korea are looking to make it two wins from two
China also won last time out and will be looking to make it two wins from two
Jurgen Klinsmann's men will be looking to get crosses into the box and make the most of Cho Gue-sung's physical presence and aerial ability
China will look to attack Korea so the Taeguk Warriors might have more space through the middle
Post-Match Reflections: Son Heung-min has declared himself fit after appearing to have picked up a knock against Singapore on Thursday
Hong Hyun-seok is out through injury with Jeonbuk's Park Jin-seob his replacement
Ai Kesen (Elkeson) is not involved despite the Brazilian-born striker keeping his Chinese nationality after returning to Brazil
Miscellaneous Highlights: China are currently ranked 79th in the world, 11th in Asia
China haven't made it to a World Cup since 2002 in Japan and South Korea
Lee Kang-in looks to be one of the players that Jurgen Klinsmann builds his team around throughout this World Cup qualification cycle and indeed at the Asian Cup next year
Others: The expectation of the Chinese public is unprecedentedly low
Even prior to the away match against Thailand, China was seen as an underdog
A dignified failure is the best scenario that people are hoping for
